Asha Thrazi, stranger.
Asha Thrazi, stranger.
My people are divided in castes in these times, until they comprehend that only the way of the {Kuridai} can save us all.
Arrogant bastards, but they wield quite powerful magics.
Dreamers are of no practical use. I don't mourn their demise.
Confused cowards. With all their skill they still tend to hide and run. What a waste.
We are the heart of the elven society. We forge, we build, and we don't allow our people to be pushed around.
It's one of the more useful concepts we can learn from the other races.
For safety we keep the door to the {hellgate} locked all times. I have the keys to open it when needed.
It was here among other structures, like the depot tower, before our people came here. It's secured by a sealed {door}.
It's hard for some of my people to grasp the true concept of a strong leader.
I mastered some spells of battle.
Not that I like to talk to you, but I am Elathriel Shadowslayer.
A human weakling, not much more.
A human weakling, not much more.
I couldn't care less.
Druids' magic is to peaceful for my taste.
I have seen human sorcerers doing some impressive things ... before they died.
We might use the shelter earth and hills provide us, but their obsession for metal is a waste of time.
Like all inferior races they can be at least used for something good. The other castes are just jealous about our use of them.
I still doubt it exists.
Even if he'd walk through the town above the other castes won't see the necessity to follow OUR way.
